Check whether or not the cluster nodes are alive

Source: R/isWorkerAlive.R
isWorkerAlive.Rd

Check whether or not the cluster nodes are alive

isWorkerAlive(x, ...)

Arguments

x

A cluster or a cluster node ("worker").
...

Not used.

Value

A logical vector of length length(x) with values FALSE, TRUE, and NA. If it can be established that the process for a cluster node is running, then TRUE is returned. If it does not run, then FALSE is returned. If neither can be inferred, for instance because the worker runs on a remote machine, then NA is returned.

Examples

cl <- makeClusterPSOCK(2)

#> [local output] Workers: [n = 2] ‘localhost’, ‘localhost’
#> [local output] Base port: 11317
#> [local output] Getting setup options for 2 cluster nodes ...
#> [local output]  - Node 1 of 2 ...
#> Testing if worker's PID can be inferred: ‘'/home/hb/software/R-devel/R-4-1-branch/lib/R/bin/Rscript' -e 'try(suppressWarnings(cat(Sys.getpid(),file="/tmp/hb/RtmppVFxHr/worker.rank=1.parallelly.parent=13360.34307da33edb.pid")), silent = TRUE)' -e "file.exists('/tmp/hb/RtmppVFxHr/worker.rank=1.parallelly.parent=13360.34307da33edb.pid')"’
#> - Possible to infer worker's PID: TRUE
#> [local output] Rscript port: 11317

#> [local output] '/home/hb/software/R-devel/R-4-1-branch/lib/R/bin/Rscript' --default-packages=datasets,utils,grDevices,graphics,stats,methods -e 'try(suppressWarnings(cat(Sys.getpid(),file="/tmp/hb/RtmppVFxHr/worker.rank=1.parallelly.parent=13360.34307da33edb.pid")), silent = TRUE)' -e 'workRSOCK <- tryCatch(parallel:::.workRSOCK, error=function(e) parallel:::.slaveRSOCK); workRSOCK()' MASTER=localhost PORT=11317 OUT=/dev/null TIMEOUT=2592000 XDR=FALSE SETUPTIMEOUT=120 SETUPSTRATEGY=parallel

## Check if cluster worker #2 is alive
print(isWorkerAlive(cl[[2]]))

#> [14:49:45.308] Attempting to find a working pid_exists_*() function ...
#> Call: tools::pskill(13360, signal = 0L)
#> [1] TRUE
#> Call: tools::pskill(13360, signal = 0L)
#> [1] TRUE
#> [14:49:45.309] - success
#> [14:49:45.309] Attempting to find a working pid_exists_*() function ... done
#> [1] TRUE

## Check all workers
print(isWorkerAlive(cl))
